The recent trend of reality programming has me thinking that there is a lack of creative talent and a certain level of laziness and immaturity in Hollywood. The programs themselves are nothing but a collection of immature brats looking for attention, fame and money. The sight of a bunch of guys acting like horny pimply adolescents in adult bodies competing for the affections of a beauty queen (the show was Average Joe) is ridiculous to say the least. Then again I saw a sitcom episode this week (I believe it was Faith and Hope) which was just as immature and childish as the typical reality horndog fest. Jenny McCarthy guest starred as a friend of one of the sisters and her character was dating their 70 year old dad. it wasn't even funny. It was just stupid. I can't believe Hollywood isn't going out of business with all this **** on TV.
I don't think all reality shows are this way. The only one I watch is Survivor and I don't find it at all childish.

I don't think all reality shows are this way. The only one I watch is Survivor and I don't find it at all childish.

 
 Your point is well taken about Survivor. I haven't watched it but my aunt and uncle do and I know they wouldn't watch something childish and stupid. I submit to you however that a majority of reality programming is. I saw an episode of some dating show on MTV where three guys were in some competition for a girl and the girl went to each of the guys bedrooms and was searching for things in one of the guys dresser. She found an unused condom and naturally was disgusted and I'm thinking "what trash is this"? Why would anyone want to watch stuff like this? You've got nudity and sex from time to time on the Real World and kids watch this stuff. And of course the FCC is all worried about Howard Stern. For crying out loud that's just radio. It doesn't matter who out there is on radio, there is no way they compete with **** that's broadcast on TV every day.

Money talks.
 
 Now that the "reality" fad has made its successful debut, many more stations are jumping on the wagon.
 
 It has literally ruined the Discovery Channel and others like it IMHO. (monster this, monster that, airline, etc.)

Money talks.

 I could not agree more. The discovery channel was once a great channel, I actually learned stuff when I watched it. Now, it is people making cars into dumb machines, people making motorcycles, people decorating houses, landscaping, dating shows, etc etc etc. TLC is even worse. Nothing but ****. I think it will be like the who wants to be a millionaire fad (there were how many shows beside the original...5?), it will fade with time...I hope. Until then, I will be busy watching the cartoon network, looking for old Flintstones re-runs. Fred is all the reality I need.

Face it reality TV is here to stay, good, bad, whatever. It is cheap TV, look at the cost of “Friends” the main actors were making $1,000,000, each episode (most don’t make that much but you get my point). By cutting the actors you save $6 million an episode, and with 13 new episodes a season, it becomes a $78million savings. So 1 million in prize money is nothing.

90% of reality shows are stupid. And yet everyone watchs it i guess to just escape or they are so bored that nothing else is on.It is getting annoying to see hundreds of reality shows are coming out and most are the same basic concept.
I think reality t.v. has very little to do with reality. I find the programing pointless.

I think reality t.v. has very little to do with reality. I find the programing pointless.

90% of reality shows are stupid. And yet everyone watchs it i guess to just escape or they are so bored that nothing else is on.It is getting annoying to see hundreds of reality shows are coming out and most are the same basic concept.

 
 They generally have a common thread. Audiences are curious to find out who gets chosen (or voted off) or just what disgusting or dangerous trick will be performed next.
 
 There is one show I may watch when it comes back...Simple Life  with Paris Hilton and Nicole Richie. I caught a few of them the first time around and they were humorous in spots.
 
 However, I lean toward documentaries and movies.
 
 The big plus for the networks regarding "reality" shows is that they are cheap to produce, don't have to have a plot but will draw a large audience.
Reality TV is pointless and stupid. I've read Sci-Fi novels that were more in tune with reality.
Anyone notice that more people vote for "American Idol" than for an election for president? emoticon_frazzled

Anyone notice that more people vote for "American Idol" than for an election for president? emoticon_frazzled

 
 That worries me. People care more about who wins a contest than who runs their lives. This country is in trouble, I think.
There are some that are (IMO) great shows; junkyard wars jumps to the top of my list,

There are some that are (IMO) great shows; junkyard wars jumps to the top of my list,

 Yes I will give you that one junkyard wars are cool.

There is nothing real  about reality TV. They choose contestants based on how they  believe they will interact with the other contestants' attitudes, moods and tempers. If they want true reality, they would just draw names out of a hat and those  would be the players- wouldn't be exciting, so they rig it to their idea of what they  want people to do. It is nothing more than an experiment- and all of us are the guinea pigs!!!!!!  emoticon_xkill emoticon_xkill 
 
 Now, that being said, I did enjoy the first Survivor. I haven't watched it since. I also enjoyed the 2nd round of Big Brother. Don't watch that anymore- if it is still around.

The following poll question appears on NBC's Average Joe website: Did Melana make the right choice? 1) Yes, she followed her heart with Jason 2) No, not picking Adam proved she's shallow 3) Who cares, AJ Hawaii starts in 4 weeks. Does it occur to you (as it did to me) that response #2 is a bit ironic? It's not like these guys were lining up to date Ms plain Jane the nun because of her charitible works. Melana is a beauty queen and they wanted her because of bikini friendly body and cover girl face. I guess that isn't shallow. Note to those in hollywood who want to get rich quick. Just televise a bunch of gorgeous, skimply dressed babes parading in front of a bunch of slobbering geeks and you've got yourself a hit.

it was called baywatch.

 
 That was BabeWatch!

it was called baywatch.

 
 Ok. That qualifies. Only difference is the slobbering geeks were in the audience instead of the show.

If reality tv endows just one "good" person with the means to do good works that might have otherwise gone undone or "less" done, then I say it's all been worthwhile. Like reality tv is any more vapid than most dramatic/comedy shows anyways.

 I happen to love Survivor and I have voted since I was 18, 17 years of voting under my belt. I think we have to remember that it is entertainment.
 Sometimes a good laugh is a welcome break from the sadness that often plagues our screens.
 Like sinjin mentioned, many people who have won, have moved on to do great things. Why not give the normal guy a shot at something in the incestuous world of show biz.
